FuncDef:
The esqm protocol disable command disables a device from performing ESQM for Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) or GPRS Tunneling Protocol (GTP) packets.
The undo esqm protocol disable command enables a device to perform ESQM for SCTP, or GTP packets.
By default, after ESQM is enabled on a device, the device performs ESQM for SCTP and GTP packets.
CLIs: undo esqm protocol { sctp | gtp } disable

ParaDef.Info:
Configures the constructing flow and sampling of sctp.
-

Configures the constructing flow and sampling of gtp.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After ESQM is enabled on a device, the device performs ESQM for SCTP and GTP packets by default. To disable the device from performing ESQM for packets of one or more of SCTP and GTP, run the esqm protocol disable command.
